alert.note: Alert for Jackson County Below 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued July 15 at 2:03AM MDT until July 15 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible. * WHERE...Mullen burn area. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning through 9 PM this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall, up to 1 inch in 30 to 45 minutes, will be possible with thunderstorms. Residents in and immediately next to recent burn scars should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, small streams and canyons, and debris flows.
info.instruction: PLAN NOW so you will know what to do in an emergency. Keep informed by listening to local radio and television for statements and possible warnings. Follow the advice of public safety officials.
